titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A doubtful morning, and much colder. I celebrated the Holy Communion in the Chapel at 8 a.m. We numbered but five Communicants including John. Lionel was celebrating later at Stockton: so, though he was present and read the Epistle, he did not communicate.
, and preached at Mattins to a congregation largely composed of Freemasons. The Vicar,

, and his wife assured me that they were both healthy and happy in the parish. I pressed on him the vital importance of visiting the people in their homes. It is this part of parsonic duty which the modern parson so commonly neglects. He prefers to write in the Parish Magazine!
I motored to Sunderland, and had tea with
, from Toronto was there. Then I went to Southwick Parish Church, & confirmed 83 persons. There was a large & attentive congregation.

acted as my Chaplain, & carried the staff. There is much to be said for holding Confirmations on Sunday, but it is too inconvenient for every parish except the one in which the Confirmation takes place. After service I returned to Auckland, & was comforted on the way by a rainbow.
